intro: Corchorus quinquenervis, commonly known as the five-veined knotweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive five-veined leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. The fibers of its stems have been traditionally used for making textiles and paper.
